newsitem.title: JAPAN: Two regional brokerages in western Japan to merge.
newsitem.headline: Two regional brokerages in western Japan to merge.

text.p: Hinomaru Securities Co said on Friday that it would merge with Daisen Securities Co on October 1 on an equal basis.
The two regional brokerages are based in Tottori prefecture in western Japan.
"The merger was decided in response to the ongoing 'Big Bang' financial reforms," said a Hinomaru spokesman.
The spokesman also said the merger would help the brokerages restructure.
Total capital of the two brokerages at the moment equals 215 million yen. Each of the brokerages has three branches.
Officials of the two brokerages said that the companies' business results for the 1996/97 fiscal year which ended on March 31 are expected to have been in the red. They declined to elaborate.
